sen.j: 馬堀駅（うまほりえき）は、京都府亀岡市篠町馬堀にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）山陰本線（嵯峨野線）の鉄道駅である。
sen.e: Umahori Station, located in Umahori, Shino-cho, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture, is the station of San'in Main Line that is operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Umahori Station, located in Umahori, Shino-cho, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a facility of San'in Main Line that is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Umahori Station, located in Umahori, Shino-cho, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a facility of Sanin Main Line that is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
The abbreviated station name for telegraph is "Fuchiuma".
The abbreviated station name (for telegraph) is "Fuchiuma."
The abbreviated station name (for telegraph) is 'Fuchiuma.'

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅（相互利用可能ICカードはICOCAの項を参照）。
sen.e: ICOCA and J-through are available at this station (regarding IC cards that are mutually usable, refer to the column of ICOCA).
ICOCA and J-through are available at this station (see the column on ICOCA regarding IC cards that are mutually usable).
ICOCA and J-through cards can be used at this station (see the column on ICOCA regarding IC cards that are mutually usable).
sen.cmt: can be used としました。

sen.j: 嵯峨野観光鉄道嵯峨野観光線（トロッコ亀岡駅） - 馬堀駅から線路沿いに東方徒歩10分（500m）
sen.e: Sagano Scenic Railway's Sagano Sight-Seeing Tram Line (Kameoka Torokko Station) - 10 minutes walk (500m) along the track from Umahori Station.
The Sagano Scenic Railway's Sagano Sight-Seeing Tram Line (Kameoka Torokko Station) is a ten-minute walk (500 m) along the track from Umahori Station.
The Sagano Scenic Railway's Sagano Sight-Seeing Tram Line (Kameoka Torokko Station) is a ten-minute walk (500 m) along the track from Umahori Station.

sen.j: 相対式2面2線プラットホームを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: This station is a ground station that has a pair of separate platforms for 2 tracks.
This station is a ground station having a pair of separate platforms for two tracks.
This station is a ground station having a pair of separate platforms for two tracks.

sen.j: 亀岡側単線・京都側複線の行き違い可能駅である。
sen.e: As Kameoka side of this station is single-track section and Kyoto side is double-track section, this station can be used by trains for passing each other.
Because the Kameoka side of this station is a single-track section and the Kyoto side is double-track section, trains can use this station to pass each other.
Because the Kameoka side of this station is a single-track section and the Kyoto side is double-track section, trains can use this station to pass each other.

sen.j: 駅本屋側が2番ホームであり、1番ホームへは跨線橋で連絡している。
sen.e: Platform 2 is situated on the side of the main station building and it is linked to platform 1 by the overpass.
Platform 2 is situated on the side of the main station building, and it's linked to Platform 1 by an overpass.
Platform 2 is situated on the side of the main station building, and it's linked to Platform 1 by an overpass.

sen.j: かつては無人駅であったが、周辺の1960年代からの宅地開発に伴う利用客数の増加に併せ有人駅化され、現在ではみどりの窓口も設置されている。
sen.e: Although the station used to be an unmanned station, it has become a manned station thanks to the increase of passengers associated with housing land development carried out nearby since 1960's and currently, JR Ticket Office "Midori-no-madoguchi" is also in service.

Although the station was once unmanned, it has become a manned station due to the increase of passengers associated with housing land development carried out nearby since the 1960s; currently, the JR Ticket Office "Midori-no-madoguchi" is also in service.

Although the station was once unmanned, it has become a manned station due to the increase of passengers associated with housing land development carried out nearby since the 1960s; currently, the JR Ticket Office "Midori-no-madoguchi" is also in service.

sen.j: なお駅業務はジェイアール西日本交通サービスへ委託されている。
sen.e: The jobs at the station are outsourced to JR West Kotsu Service.
The work conducted at the station is outsourced to JR West Kotsu Service.
The work conducted at the station is outsourced to JR-West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.
sen.cmt: ジェイアール西日本交通サービス の表記を変更しました。
表現を他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約4,690人である。（京都府統計書より）
sen.e: Average number of passengers a day in 2006 was 4690 (based on the statistics complied by Kyoto Prefectural Government).
According to statistics compiled by the Kyoto Prefectural Government, the average number of passengers a day in 2006 was 4,690.
According to statistics compiled by the Kyoto Prefectural Government, the average number of passengers a day in fiscal year 2006 was 4,690.

sen.j: 京都などのベッドタウンである場所柄、駅規模に比較して利用客が非常に多く時間帯によっては京都方面への列車は相当な混雑になる。
sen.e: As the surrounding area of the station is bedroom suburbs of Kyoto, the number of passengers is quite big relative to the size of the station and the congestion of the trains bound for Kyoto is relatively heavy.

Because the surrounding area of the station consists of bedroom suburbs of Kyoto, the number of passengers is quite large relative to the size of the station and the congestion of the trains bound for Kyoto is relatively heavy.

Because the surrounding area of the station consists of bedroom suburbs of Kyoto, the number of passengers is quite large relative to the size of the station and the congestion of the trains bound for Kyoto is relatively heavy during certain hours.

sen.j: また、最寄りに嵯峨野観光線の終点があるため、周辺住民からは快速列車の停車を希望する声が多い。
sen.e: In addition, as the terminal of the Sagano Sight-Seeing Tram Line is located at short distance, many of nearby residents hope Rapid trains stop at this station.
Additionally, as the terminal of the Sagano Sight-Seeing Tram Line is located a short distance away, many nearby residents hope the rapid trains will stop at this station.
Additionally, as the terminal of the Sagano Sight-Seeing Tram Line is located a short distance away, many nearby residents hope the rapid trains will stop at this station.

sen.j: トロッコ亀岡駅との乗換駅でもあり、観光客の利用も多い。
sen.e: Many tourists use this station as it is a transfer station to Kameoka Torokko Station.
Many tourists use this station, since it's a transfer station to Kameoka Torokko Station.
Many tourists use this station, since it's a transfer station to Kameoka Torokko Station.

sen.j: 亀岡市立図書館馬堀分館
sen.e: Umahori Branch Library of Kameoka City Library
Umahori Branch Library of Kameoka City Library
Umahori Branch of Kameoka City Library
Shotoku Junior High School, Kameoka City
Shotoku Junior High School, Kameoka City
Shotoku Junior High School, Kameoka City

sen.j: 平和堂アル・プラザ亀岡
マツモト_(京都府) ベルタウン馬堀
京都北都信用金庫（北都信金 ほくとしんきん）馬堀支店
sen.e: Umahori Branch, Kyoto Hokuto Shinkin Bank
Umahori Branch, Kyoto Hokuto Shinkin Bank
Umahori Branch, Kyoto Hokuto Shinkin Bank

sen.j: 旧山陰道（京都府道402号王子並河線）
sen.e: Old San'in Expressway (Kyoto prefectural road No.402, Oji Namikawa Route)
Old San'in Expressway (Kyoto Prefectural Road No. 402, Oji Namikawa Route)
Old Sanin Expressway (Oji Namikawa Line of Kyoto Prefectural Route 402)
sen.cmt: 道路表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 1935年（昭和10年）7月20日 - 日本国有鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: July 20, 1935 - The station commenced operation as the station of Japan National Raiways (JNR).
July 20, 1935 - The station commenced operation as a facility of Japan National Railways (JNR).
July 20, 1935: The station commenced operation as a facility of Japan National Railways (JNR).

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987 - The station became the station of JR West thanks to the division and privatization of JNR.
April 1, 1987 - The station became a facility of JR West due to the division and privatization of JNR.
April 1, 1987: The station became a facility of JR West due to the division and privatization of JNR.

sen.j: 1989年（平成元年）3月5日 - 嵯峨嵐山駅～当駅間が新線に切り替え。
sen.e: March 5, 1989 - The section between Saga-Arashiyama and this station was replaced by newly constructed track.
March 5, 1989 - The section between Saga-Arashiyama and this station was replaced by newly constructed track.
March 5, 1989: The section between Saga-Arashiyama and this station was replaced by newly constructed track.
The station was moved to the current place.
The station was moved to its current location.
The station was moved to its current location.

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）

sen.cmt: 統一しました。■を削除しました
